intro: Andryala cheiranthifolia var. congesta, commonly known as the clustered sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand arid and cold conditions. This variety is often found in rocky soils and alpine environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh climates.
